text: 6 years - didn’t realize it had been that long
Grantland getting some prime eyeballs there.   wonder if that rotates or if they will always be featured so prominently
I’m happy to be done with carousels
i really dig the responsive-ness. does way more than just re-size. changes for context.
this is also pretty great. does way more than just give the next game / previous score. <https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/spa/5rar3xay44yc491/uhutblbq.png>
I can't believe that I'm speaking so highly of ESPN.
The context relevant twitter feed in the third column is actually well executed.
bummer they didn’t do anything with the team pages though

attachments.title: Washington State Cougars
attachments.text: Washington State Cougars football scores, news, schedule, players, stats, photos, rumors, and video highlights on <http://ESPN.com|ESPN.com>.

text: they've been doing something similar in the app for a while. guess they read "mobile first"
but i hear you. I can't imagine how much shit this effects. Like, fantasy alone is going to be a bear.
right - maybe that will roll out in phases.
I just realized they are doing the <http://forbes.com|forbes.com> thing on reading actual content.
one article ends, and the next one starts - infinite scroll - you barely even realize you switched articles, not just a different section of the article you were on.
at the same time the left column is awesome - showing 10,000ft view of the article stream with a scroll progress indicator for how much left on the current story
